contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 24, 2016 D Swiss Open
Swiss Open 0 March, Hymn and Own Choice Test Piece Contest
swiss-open
Swiss Open Contest presented nearly 50 different Bands from 11 Countries in it's 25 Years of History till 2014. It was held in Kultur-Casino Bern first and since 1999 the 'Salle Blanche' in KKL Luzern provides a wonderful Frame for this popular Event.
See Also Contest Website: http://www.worldbandfestival.ch/ Switzerland
Set Test and Own Choice
Harmony Music
Kultur und Kongresszentrum (KKL), Luzern, Switzerland Best March: Valaisia Brass Band Best Own Choice: Ensemble de Cuivres Valaisan
About current Adjudication: The adjudication system saw the five judges mark each performance separately and without conferring, in both disciplines out of 60 points. The top and bottom mark was taken away to leave three marks accounting for a maximum of 180. The totals from each section were added together to give the final total.
Sept. 24, 2014, 11:21 a.m. April 21, 2019, 9:02 a.m.
1 Ensemble de Cuivres Valaisan Francois Roh Symphonic Dances [Rachmaninov]
2 Brassband Bürgermusik Luzern Michael Bach Le Roi d'Ys
3 Brass Band Treize Etoiles James Gourlay Symphony No 1 - Finale [Rachmaninov]
4 Brass Band Berner Oberland Corsin Tuor Vetrate di Chiesa [O. Respighi]
5 Valaisia Brass Band Arsène Duc Russian Easter Festival Overture [N. Rimski-Korsakov, arr. B. Moren]
6 Brass Band Fribourg Robert Childs Finale from Symphony No.1 (Titan) [G. Mahler]
7 Wallberg Brass Band Garry Cutt Night on a Bare Mountain [Modest Mussorgsky]
8 Oberaargauer Brass Band Gian Walker Firebird (excerpts)
9 Brass Band Luzern Land Hervé Grélat Polovtsian Dances
10 Liberty Brass Band Ostschweiz Andreas Koller Le Carnaval Romain [arr. Lorriman]
